item.title: 5 Open-World Games Worth Playing Just For Their Driving
item.description:
Open-world titles have progressed by leaps and bounds since they took over mainstream gaming. A well-designed sandbox isn't enough to attract players. Along with a detailed world, these games need to feature a myriad of gameplay loops that will keep fans interested until the end of these engaging experiences. Numerous elements are integrated into these games to make the open worlds feel as engaging as possible, and focusing on a dynamic mode of traversal is a great area to build upon.

This leads to some open-world games with driving mechanics that are so polished and engaging that most players won't mind spending hours upon hours messing around with the many unique and familiar vehicles they can get their hands on. Open-world games that consider driving to be a major gameplay pillar will love any game that executes this aspect with great skill, letting players zoom through the streets in style. Since any open-world racing game can qualify here, they will be ignored in favor of titles that feature other mechanics as well.

5 Mad Max

The Vehicular Combat Is A Major Pillar Of Gameplay That's A Joy To Experience

It's a shame that many people did not check out Mad Max when this underrated title came out. Players will forget about any narrative issues once they get their hands on a vehicle and see how much work was put into this aspect of the game. Cars are heavily customizable and can be kitted out with numerous weapons to take out the opposition in style.

The sheer joy players can experience while driving around vast expanses of the wasteland while completing the title's many missions forms one of the game's many highlights. The Arkham -inspired combat system feels crunchy if somewhat derivative, so fans will love the sections where they jump into the Magnum Opus and wreck their foes with the numerous upgrades they've fitted on this vehicle.

4 Batman: Arkham Knight

Controlling The Batmobile Is As Cathartic As They Come

Many fans complained about the integration of the Batmobile in Arkham Knight and how it dominated a chunk of the gameplay. While it's true that Batman's vehicle plays a major role in some missions, it's balanced with many on-foot free-roam sections coupled with the iconic Arkham combat fans have grown to love.

With the reception to this game warming up over time, more people have come to appreciate the Batmobile as one of the best vehicles players can use to zip around the streets of Gotham. The car is loaded with several weapons and can become a makeshift tank when required. With its boosters and drifts making the driving sections more engaging, it's easy to see why the driving mechanics in Arkham Knight are a huge achievement that helps this game stand out as one of the best Batman games.

3 Grand Theft Auto 5

Excellent Driving Mechanics To Speed Through A Sprawling City

It's only a given that any Grand Theft Auto game would be hailed for its driving mechanics, with this aspect of the title wowing fans from the very moment players got to drive around in a vehicle in Grand Theft Auto 3 . This gameplay pillar has been improved and polished time and time again in the other GTA games, with Grand Theft Auto 5 featuring the best driving mechanics the series has ever seen.

The fact that the attention to cars and other vehicles in GTA 5 rivals that of bonafide racing games shows the amazing talents at work in Rockstar Games. These systems are a joy to interact with and go a long way in ensuring that controlling characters like Franklin and using his powers to handle cars efficiently never ceases to be engaging. Fans who want to race against other players can do the same in GTA Online , with the driving mechanics of this title getting even more time in the spotlight.

2 Sleeping Dogs

Action-Packed Driving Where Players Can Jump Off Their Vehicle Onto Other Ones In Daring Stunts

In all honestly, the driving mechanics in Sleeping Dogs themselves aren't what sells this portion of the game. Fans of Hong Kong action cinema love the focus on practical stunts and how something as formulaic as a car chase can turn into moments of pure drama as the heroes put it all on the line to jump onto other vehicles and take control. With Sleeping Dogs going a long way in emulating the immaculate vibes of these old-school action movies, it's fascinating to see this action-packed driving be replicated in the game.

The floaty driving mechanics go a long way in making car chases more arcadey and memorable, with players being encouraged to ram vehicles to make the chase easier. Along with this, players can perform Action Hijacks by jumping out of their car and landing on others before taking control. It's a simple yet effective way to make driving sequences more engaging than most other open-world games and makes up for the questionable handling in most vehicles.

1 Cyberpunk 2077

Soaking In The Atmosphere Of Night City While Driving Around Is Amazing

Driving around Night City with cyberpunk aesthetics that aided in making Cyberpunk 2077 so iconic made the entire game more memorable than it already was. Night City was immersive, and stepping into the shoes of V, a merc on a time limit, made the impending sense of death seem all too real, with vehicular speed and action helping to take the edge off.

The neon-soaked seats and cramped urban locales add to the wonder players experience while driving around in the vehicle of their choice, with motorbikes being especially beloved by the masses for letting them see their custom character from a third-person POV. Regardless of which vehicle players choose, zooming around the world and engaging in vehicle combat shows the strengths of Cyberpunk 2077 's driving mechanics and why they deserve more credit now.

item.title: Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance - Best Support Demons For Buffs
item.description:
Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance sees the return of old demons as well as the addition of some new ones. The game has so many demons that it can actually give players a headache when it comes to deciding which demon to bring and utilize in certain situations.

Some demons do better than others when it comes to taking up the role of a buffer – a support demon that will increase ally stats or damage output. These are the best demons, depending on where the player is in the game to get to buff their allies.

Early Game (Level 1-20)

Neko Shogun

  • Support Level: +3
  • Race: Wargod
  • Level Unlocked at: 5

The very best buff demon the player can have access to in the game is Neko Shogun. This demon is unlocked at just level 5, making him accessible very early on.

Mermaid

  • Support Level: +2
  • Race: Femme
  • Level Unlocked at: 12

The Mermaid is a demon that can be uncooked at level 12 in SMTV: Vengeance . This early-game demon can be quite useful for buffs as she has a support level of +2. She can get access to a skill known as Rakukaja +2 which allows her to raise the defense of one ally by one rank for 3 turns.

Ippon-Datara

  • Support Level: +2
  • Race: Brute
  • Level Unlocked at: 17

Ippon-Datara is a demon the player will be able to unlock by level 17 of the game. He has a support level of +2 and can access a good early-game buffing skill, Tarukaja. This allows him to increase the attack of one ally by one rank for 3 turns. This makes Ippon-Datara a good early-game buffing demon.

Andras

  • Support Level: +2
  • Race: Fallen
  • Level Unlocked at: 18

Andras is one of the later demons that can be unlocked early in the game, but it is definitely one of the best when it comes to buffing allies. His support level is +2 and he comes with the skill Sukukaja +2 that can raise evasion and accuracy for one ally.

Mid Game (Level 21-50)

Koropokkur

  • Support Level: +3
  • Race: Jirae
  • Level Unlocked at: 26

Koropokkur is definitely a demon the player will run across while they’re playing SMTV: Vengeance. This demon has a support level of +3 and comes with the skill Tarukaja, which allows it to raise an ally's attack. Being unlocked at level 26 makes it one of the earliest the player can get mid-game.

Cironnup

  • Support Level: +4
  • Race: Holy
  • Level Unlocked at: 27

Cironnup has one of the highest support levels the player can come across, at +4. This makes him one of the best buffing demons the player can find around mid-game, being unlockable at level 27. He has a unique skill, Cautious Cheer +4, that allows him to raise the defense, accuracy, and evasion of all allies by 1 rank for 3 turns.

Jatayu

  • Support Level: +3
  • Race: Avian
  • Level Unlocked at: 32

Jatayu is definitely a great demon for buffing that can be unlocked mid-game. This demon has a support level of +3 and can be accessed at level 32. He can buff all allies by using Masukukaja which increases their accuracy and evasion by one rank for 3 turns. His innate skill, Critical Melody, also allows him to increase the critical damage of all allies.

Sarasvati

  • Support Level: +2
  • Race: Megami
  • Level Unlocked at: 47

Sarasvati is one of the later mid-game demons, becoming available at level 47 for the player. Her support level is +2, which isn’t the highest seen, but she has a skill known as Donum Galdi, which allows her to increase the power of the next strength attack of an ally.

Konohana Sakuya

  • Support Level: +3
  • Race: Kunitsu
  • Level Unlocked at: 50

Konohana Sakuya is a DLC demon in SMTV: Vengeance , meaning the player won’t be able to have access to her without buying the DLC. Konohana Sakuya is a great demon for buffing, having a base level of 50, and a support level of +3. Her unique skill Sakuya Sakura allows her to raise all stats of all allies for 3 turns while also healing the allies HP and restoring some MP.

Late Game (Level 51-75)

Ganesha

  • Support Level: +4
  • Race: Wargod
  • Level Unlocked at: 57

Ganesha is a demon that can be fused at level 57 and has a very high support level, being +4. He doesn’t have any amazing support skills but the player can definitely have him inherit one easily.

He does have a skill that can boost himself, called Fierce Roar. This skill draws all the enemy's attention to him and raises his defense by one rank for 3 turns.

Cleopatra

  • Support Level: +5
  • Race: Femme
  • Level Unlocked at: 61

Cleopatra has the highest support level in SMTV: Vengeance, at +5, making her one of the best demons to use for buffing. She’s unlocked at level 61 and unlike in the original game, Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance has her free of charge and not as a DLC character that the player has to pay for to get.

She has access to one of the best buffing skills in the game, Luster Candy, which allows her to increase all stats of all allies by one rank for 3 turns.

Lakshmi

  • Support Level: +3
  • Race: Megami
  • Level Unlocked at: 70

Lakshmi is an amazing late-game buffer in SMTV . She can be unlocked at level 70, which makes her very late game, and has a support level of +3. Her own innate skill, Chanchala, can be extremely useful for buffed allies. She can also make use of Luster Candy, a skill that raises all stats of all allies by one rank for 3 turns.

Lilith

  • Support Level: +3
  • Race: Qadištu
  • Level Unlocked at: 72

Lilith in SMTV: Vengeance replaces the old one that was in SMTV , and plays a major role in this game. This character can be unlocked at level 72, which is clearly late game. Her support level is +3, and she has access to a great skill known as Luster Candy, which allows her to raise all stats of all Allies by one rank for 3 turns.

End Game (Level 76+)

Alilat

  • Support Level: +3
  • Race: Lady
  • Level Unlocked at: 81

Alilat is an endgame demon that is definitely one of the best when it comes to healing and buffing. She’s unlocked at level 81 and has a support level of +3. She has access to 2 skills, Donum Magici and Donum Gladi. These skills allow her to increase the next magic or strength-based attack of an ally, depending on which she uses.

Danu

  • Support Level: +2
  • Race: Lady
  • Level Unlocked at: 93

Danu is a character that can be unlocked at level 93 and has a support level of +2. Her innate skill itself makes her very useful as a buffer as it allows her to weaken attacks that don’t strike the allies’ weakness if their defense is raised by 2 ranks. She also has access to Cluster Candy, which is a powerful buffing skill, and she has Matriarch’s Love which allows her to cure status ailments and remove rebuffs for all allies.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Rogue - World premiere cinematic trailer
item.description: Introducing Assassin’s Creed® Rogue, the darkest chapter in the Assassin’s Creed franchise yet. As Shay, you will experience the slow transformation from Assassin to Assassin Hunter.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Embercore Flower Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Embercore Flower Locations - Sulfurous Veins
  • Embercore Flower Locations - Tequemecan Valley
  • Embercore Flower Locations - Scions of the Canopy
  • Embercore Flower Locations- Teticpac Peak
  • Embercore Flower Locations - Ameyalco Waters
  • Embercore Flower Locations - Stadium of the Sacred Flame

Embercore Flowers are strange flaming buds which are located across Natlan in Genshin Impact . They bloom upon being hit and their name derives from the flaming cores they have. These flowers also have Phlogiston particles, so when they are plucked can be used to restore your Phlogiston bar when needed.

There are only 29 Embercore Flowers in the area and most of them are pretty easy to collect. Most of them will be buds, so when farming, remember to hit them or use your Saurians attack to open it up. The flower will be in the middle to grab. This guide will follow the best route available to collect all of the flowers in Genshin Impact .

Embercore Flower Locations - Sulfurous Veins

When you’re at the Sulfurous Veins, teleport to the waypoint at the far north of the region and glide down to find one Embercore Flower near a bush surrounded by some alpacas. From there, head to the next teleport waypoint east of the map to collect the next three in the region. Turn left from the waypoint, and head towards the clearing you see to grab the first one. Then, head south on the map to find the rest of them.

To grab the last few, teleport to the waypoint in the middle of Sulfurous Veins and glide across to the other rock . There are five Embercore Flowers here for you to collect. After that, jump off the southern end of the cliff and glide down to find the last one.

Embercore Flower Locations - Tequemecan Valley

Teleport to the Statue of Seven in the valley and head behind it to find the first flower in the area. From there, head northeast to find the other two located near a long-necked rhino and a tribal warrior camp. Next, teleport to the Ancient Watchtower domain, turn right and head towards the cliffs. There will be another Embercore Flower in the area.

Embercore Flower Locations - Scions of the Canopy

There’s only one Embercore Flower near Scions of the Canopy and you can glide down from the reputation teleport waypoint. Just head left from the waypoint and glide down to find one on a small cliff beside a waterfall.

Embercore Flower Locations- Teticpac Peak

There’s a cluster of Embercore Flowers on Teticpac Peak that can be farmed by Genshin Impact players. Use the teleport waypoint near the water and run south on the map to find two flowers that can be farmed. Then, keep going straight and jump down to another area where you can find one more flower to collect.

Teleport back to the previous waypoint near the water and run northeast on the map to find three more Embercore Flowers .

Embercore Flower Locations - Ameyalco Waters

Use the teleport waypoint closest to Teticpac Peak ( north of the Statue of Seven) and glide down to find an Embercore Flower hidden behind some bushes. Next, teleport to the underground waypoint in Ameyalco Waters to grab the next six Embercore Flowers . You can just follow the above route shown since the area is filled with lava (liquid phlogiston) and pretty hard to traverse. Players can either use an Anemo character or the Koholasaurus in the area to navigate the waters.

Players should note that this area is only accessible after completing the Tracer No Tracing and Seeking No Finding Quest . The area is quest locked and there is no other way to open the teleport waypoint here.

Embercore Flower Locations - Stadium of the Sacred Flame

The final Embercore Flower is located north of the Stadium of the Sacred Flame and you can just teleport to the waypoint north of the area and glide down to find it near a Tepetlisaurus.

item.title: Botany Manor - Release Date Trailer
item.description: Welcome to Botany Manor, a stately home in 19th century England. You play as inhabitant Arabella Greene, a retired botanist. Explore your house and gardens, filled with research, to figure out the ideal habitat of forgotten flora.
